text:
------------- quote ----------------------------
->HTTP Request (GET)
[ host: jakarta.apache.org
port: 80
protocol: http
path: / ]
-> Regular Expression Extractor
[Ref Name: TestID
Reg. Exp: timeout=(.*?)\,
Template: $1$
Math No.: 0
Default Value: nothin]
->HTTP Request (GET)
[host: jakarta.apache.org
port: 80
protocol: http
path: /images/${TestID} 
Param: 
Name= Test_ID
Value= $TestID
]
-> View Results Tree

----------------------------------------------

Run it and check View Results Tree.  The 2nd HTTP Request Data shows
something like this:

http://jakarta.apache.org/images/${TestID}?Test_ID=5

The result should be:
http://jakarta.apache.org/images/5?Test_ID=5

Note that ${TestID} is evaluated to 5 for the parameter but not in the PATH
field.

--------------- end of quote ---------------------

I've tried this, and I got:

http://jakarta.apache.org/images/5?Test_ID=$TestID

after correcting the Parameter value to ${TestID} I get:

http://jakarta.apache.org/images/5?Test_ID=5

which does not agree with the e-mail.

Test case, properties file and jmeter.log files to follow.

Perhaps there is a setting in the properties file that causes a problem?

I'm using WinXP Home, with:
java version "1.4.2_03"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_03-b02)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_03-b02, mixed mode)
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
This only seems to happen on Java 1.3 (in my case 1.3.1_10). No errors are 
shown in the log file, nor are any displayed on the console.

Needs to be investigated further.

Created attachment 11180
Another testcase that fails using JMeter 2.0.0, j2sdk 1.4.2
creator: johan@kanngard.net
sebb@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the attachment - that explains the problem.

The test plan (attachment dated 04/08/04 09:50 id 11180) has the following 
structure:

Thread Group
-HTTP Sampler
-Regex Extractor
-HTTP Sampler (using the extracted variable)
-HTTP Sampler (using the extracted variable)
-View Results Tree

This looks OK, but it actually applies the Regex Assertion to EACH of the 
Samplers, i.e. it is equivalent to:

-HTTP Sampler
--Regex Extractor
-HTTP Sampler (using the extracted variable)
--Regex Extractor
-HTTP Sampler (using the extracted variable)
--Regex Extractor
-View Results Tree

The same applies to the View Results Tree listener - it can be placed anywhere 
directly under the Thread Group, and it will still show all the results. It 
does not have to be at the end.

The following test plan works OK:
Thread Group
-HTTP Sampler
-- Regex Extractor
-HTTP Sampler (using the extracted variable)
-HTTP Sampler (using the extracted variable)
-View Results Tree

(i.e. the Regex Extractor needs to be added as a child of the HTTP request)
